revised_title: Magnetism, Geology, and the History of the Earth: Dr. Wallis's Analysis of Chartham News and Related Discoveries
tldr: Dr. Wallis discusses the discovery of large bones, possibly from an elephant, found in a gravel pit near Harwich, Essex. He also examines the geological history of the area, including the estuaries of the River Stour, and the impact of tides and tidal changes on the landscape. Additionally, Wallis explores the process of petrification and its relation to the natural world.
